newsitem.title: UK: UK Oct jobless fall may be exaggerated - ONS.
newsitem.headline: UK Oct jobless fall may be exaggerated - ONS.

text.p: A 40,800 fall in October UK unemployment may have been exaggerated by about 10,000 to 15,000 as job centres struggled with a backlog of claims following the introduction of the jobseekers allowance, the Office for National Statistics said on Wednesday.
But it said this distortion was purely operational and may be corrected next month .
The jobseekers allowance replaced unemployment benefit from October 6 and requires claimants to be actively seeking work.
